intro: Guettarda clarensis, commonly known as the Caribbean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the West Indies. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Guettarda clarensis thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils along the shoreline.
